rule: The output contains only the required part-of-speech tag or the words 'Unknown' or 'CantAnswer', with no additional text, punctuation, or formatting.
input: Sentence: 'I will call you tomorrow.' Word: 'tomorrow'
validityText:
The input consists of a sentence and a word. The sentence provided is 'I will call you tomorrow.', which is a valid string of words, including punctuation. The word provided is 'tomorrow', which is a word present within the sentence 'I will call you tomorrow.'.

According to the input specification, the sentence can include punctuation and symbols, and the word must be present in the sentence. There are no restrictions on the length of either the sentence or the word. In this case, both conditions of the specification are met: 'tomorrow' is indeed part of the sentence 'I will call you tomorrow.', ignoring punctuation.

There is no indication that any rules have been violated. Thus, the input complies with the input specification.
